title: 1234 left behind
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" leaves a remainder of 1234 when divided by 2013, what is the remainder when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divided by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 183 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number N can be written in the format :"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dividend = Divisor * Quotient + Remainder as"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = 2013 * Q + 1234"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This can be written as "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = 183 * 11 * Q + 1234"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dividing both sides by 183 , we get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N/183 = 11 * Q + 1234/183"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N/183 = 11 * Q + (1098 +136)/183"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N/183 = 11 * Q + 6 + 136/183"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Multiplying both sides by 183 , we get "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = 183 * ( 11* Q + 6 ) + 136"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If 11* Q + 6 = K"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = 183 * K + 136"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"which means 136 is the remainder when N is divided by 183"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

then divided 3247 by 183 and got 136

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            This seems to be true for all N that are congruent to 1234 mod 2013. Why is that the case?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                            Yes, replacing "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N-1234"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will work. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The rest of the proof can be expressed clearer, but I understand what you are trying to say.

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I apologize for the blunder made...
It will be (N-1234) which is exactly divisible by 2013. Moreover as 183 is also a factor of 2013 it will completely divide (N-1234) leaving no remainder. But 183 being smaller than 2013 can divide the term, N, further, diminishing the remainder of 1234 by an amount x(as it is clear 183 cannot completely divide 1234). Hence, it will be a term (1234-x) which will be the remainder when N is divided by 183. It comes out that when 183 is multiplied by 6 the product is 1098 and when multiplied by 7 the product is 1281(greater than the term 1234 and of course when added to N-1234 yields a number greater than N which is not at par with the question.) Thus Subtracting 1098 from 1234 we yield a term 136 which is finally the remainder(i.e. can no more be divided by 183.)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Master, Kindly comment on this explanation and oblige. 
I will be so very grateful to you for pointing out my misunderstanding of the problem.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number N can be written in the format : "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dividend = Divisor * Quotient + Remainder as "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = 2013 * Q + 1234 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This can be written as "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = 183 * 11 * Q + 1234 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dividing both sides by 183 , we get "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N/183 = 11 * Q + 1234/183 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N/183 = 11 * Q + (1098 +136)/183 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N/183 = 11 * Q + 6 + 136/183 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Multiplying both sides by 183 , we get "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = 183 * ( 11* Q + 6 ) + 136 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If 11* Q + 6 = K "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = 183 * K + 136 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"which means 136 is the remainder when N is divided by 183"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":""If the integer N leaves a reminder of 1234 when divided by 2013""}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"since brilliant mathematics answers are integer values from 0 to 999 inclusive, so logically we can assume that N is 1234. N  divided 2013 leaves 2013."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we find out what is the remainder when N is divided by 183, so :"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 1234"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" mod "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"183"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 136"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus it means the correct answer is 136"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            That doesn't matter. 2013 is divisible by 183, this means that we know that we only need to deal with 1234. N could be any multiple of 2013. But yes, the rest of it is right.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 1-2-3-4 Nostalgia
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/d57ffb8a29.7110eda4d0.NUpmQS.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
What are the last two digits of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^{1234}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Source: Loren C. Larson, Problem-Solving Through Problems, Problem no. 3.2.3 (without modification)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is a part of the set Along Came A Spider.."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^{1234}\\=9^{617}\\=(10-1)^{617}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using binomial expansion,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(10-1)^{617}=\binom{617}{0}10^{617}-\binom{617}{1}10^{616}+...-\binom{617}{615}10^{2}+\binom{617}{616}10-\binom{617}{617}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=100k+6170-1=100\alpha+69"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^{1234}\equiv 69\mod 100"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So the last two digits are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{69}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Nice. Can we use binomial expansion for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7^{1234}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"? We have already considered this solution (before we posted ours, when we were discussing various approaches), and decided to not post it, because, we could not stand this procedure for other cases; in short, we could not generalize. Can you help?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7^{1234}=49^{617}\\=(50-1)^{617}\\\binom{617}{0}50^{617}-\binom{617}{1}50^{616}+...+\binom{617}{616}50-\binom{617}{617}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=617×50-1\\=3084"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So last two digits would be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{84}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I can't generalize it, but this can be used for almost every number I can think of right now."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Can you give me an example of such number?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Thanks. There are infinite examples. Are you asking for a typical exponential representation such as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"123^{456}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^0 = 1 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^1 = 3 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^2 = 9 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^3 = 27 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^4 = 81 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^5 = 243 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^6 = 729 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^7 = 2187 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^8 = 6561 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^9 = 19683 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^10 = 59049"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^11 = 177147 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^12 = 531441 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^13 = 1594323"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^14 = 4782969"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^15 = 14348907 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^16 = 43046721"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^17 = 129140163"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^18 = 387420489"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^19 = 1162261467"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^20 = 3486784401 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^21 = 10460353203"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^22 = 31381059609 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^23 = 94143178827 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^24 = 282429536481 
."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Notice how the pattern of the last two digits repeats from the power 20. If you take 1234/20 you get 14 as a remainder, so: 
3^1234 will have the same last 2 digits as 3^14 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence the answer is 69"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Euler's Theorem","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" (A little advanced approach for an elementary problem):"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We will use 
"},{"type":"text","text":"Euler's totient function","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" to count how many integers are relatively prime to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\phi (100) =\phi (2^25^2)= 100(1-\frac12)(1-\frac15)=40"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, Euler's theorem implies that, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^{40}\equiv 1\; (mod\; 100)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^{1234}\equiv (3^{40})^{30}(3^{34})\equiv (3^{40-6})\; (mod\; 100)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, our duty is curbed down to find the inverse of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^6\equiv (27)^2 \equiv 29 \;(mod \; 100)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The inverse, my friends, is easily found to be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{69}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The last step is left as a homework."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If a number has "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textit{n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  terminal "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textit{zeros} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then it contains "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textit{n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". But since  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10=5\cdot 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we are asking how many how many factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are there. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is smaller than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", for any factor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" there will be enough factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to make a factor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". thus we need to count only factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1239 \div 5 = 247.8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"247"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1239"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But the numbers divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"25"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of which "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we have counted."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1239 \div 25 = 49.56"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"49"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" again "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly, there will be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"125"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1239"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of which "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we have counted "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1239 \div 125 = 9.912"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" again "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"similarly there will be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factor again of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" taking into consideration "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"625"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which contain "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, there are total "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 247+49+9+1 = 306 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"
